page.title: 06 GRAVES PARK
page.content:
Most of the{206 acres}or more of Sheffield's largest park is open land.In{1925}Alderman John George Graves gave the land,which included Waterfall Wood,Summer House Wood,and the Deer Park where deer once roamed,to Sheffield City Council.
The park is comprised of a miniature golf course,tennis courts,bowling greens,boating,fishing and wildfowl lakes,and numerous cricket and football pitches.
Other attractions include orienteering which started in{1983,}as well as part of Sheffield's{Round {Walk,}and reserves for various species of unusual domestic animals.
A{Motor Show}is held in the park each year in June.
